lines.gurmukhi: joeI imlY Awpw Koie soeI qau nwXkw hoie mwn kIey mwnmqI pweIAY n mwn jI
lines.transliteration_english: Joee Milai Aapaa Khoi Soee Tau Naayakaa Hoi , Maan Keeay Maanamatee Paaeeai N Maan Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The seeker woman who sheds her ego and meets with dear husband, she alone is the loved wife of the husband. One cannot get honour and respect from the Lord if one feels haughty and egoistic.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Gnhr brsY srbqR sm aucY n cVq jl bsq nIcwn jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ghanahar Barasai Sarabatr Sama , Ouchai N Charhat Jal Basat Neechaan Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as clouds rain equally in all places, its water cannot climb up the mounds. Water always go and settles at lower levels.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn smIp jYsy bUfRXo hY bfweI bwNs Aws pws ibrK subws prvwn jI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Sameep Jaisay Boodyo Hai Badaaee Baansa , Aas Paas Birakh Soubaas Paravaan Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a bamboo stays in his pride of being high and lofty and remains bereft of the fragrance of sandalwood, but all big and small trees and plants absorb that sweet smell in themselves.

lines.gurmukhi: kiRpw isMD piRX qIX hoie mrjIvw giq pwvq prmgiq srb inDwn jI ]662]
lines.transliteration_english: Kripaa Sindh Priy Teey Hoi Marajeevaa Gati , Paavat Paramagati Sarab Nidhaan Jee ?662?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, to be the wife of the ocean of kindness-dear Lord, one has to sacrifice oneself and become a living dead person. Only then can one acquire the treasure of all treasures (God's name from the True Guru) and reach the supreme divine state.  (662)
